summary:
Here is a concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
- Reaffirms previous resolutions on terrorism, particularly resolution 1636 (2005).
- Condemns the 14 February 2005 terrorist bombing in Beirut and demands accountability.
- Commends the International Independent Investigation Commission (S/2005/775) for its work.
- Extends the Commission's mandate until 15 June 2006 to assist Lebanese authorities.
- Demands Syria cooperate fully and unconditionally with the Commission.
- Requests the Commission to report every three months on progress and Syrian cooperation.
- Acknowledges Lebanon's request for an international tribunal to try those responsible.
- Authorizes the Commission to provide technical assistance for investigations into other terrorist attacks in Lebanon since 1 October 2004.
Requests the Secretary-General to continue providing the Commission with necessary support and resources; Decides to remain seized of the matter.
